comments.text: Very good spot, cars going slowly and there's a lot of place to stop
26.04.14 waited for 20min for a ride almost to Kaunas
Never takes longer than 30min, usually around 15
Two people using a Lit flag got picked by a truck for 60KM towards Bauska. We stood after the trrafic circule, where there is some place for cars to stop and waited for about 20 minutes.

The name of the spot is misleading - this place has nothing to with Salaspils. It is a roundabout 2km form town called Ķekava.

Well usually it is a very good spot, i don`t know why on 24.08.2011 it took me 4h to get out of there. Before that it was never longer than 10-15 minutes. 

You can get there from Riga by taking minibus Riga-Ķekava and the stop is on the opposite side of the main Riga train station building - you will see a lot of yellow minibuses, just go and look for the bus NR-6844.
The perfect hitchhiker stop, because there is a STOP sign at the rail-crossing. Everybody has to stop and most people feel obligated to take hitchhikers.

Best gas station on the road especially if headed to south, lots of long distance traffic, trucks (mainly tho Latvians themselves) and all kinds of people, in both the gas station and hesburger, wait time 20 minutes (knowing russian helps)
Lots of cars going both directions, good spot to talk to people
Good spot with plenty of traffic and space for cars to stop. Can also ask around at the gas station parking lot. There is a Hesburger nearby so there's shelter if the weather gets bad.
got picked without even hitchhiking, someone saw me walking next to road and offered me a ride immediately.
less than 5 min and you're in the car. if drivers can't pick you up at least they wave.

I waited less than 5 minutes at this spot, when hitchhiking to Radviliskis, Lithuania.  I got a ride directly to Siauliai!  (Which about 20 km away from Radviliskis).  Just make a big LT sign, and you're set!

Very good spot in case you want to avoid Riga city. Get from A8 to A5, then get a ride to Salaspils or even straight to the direction of Tallin. I usually wait 5-10 min. The uncomfortable thing is that some drivers will offer a ride to one of following roundabouts.
fantastic spot to get a ride to Europe !!!
Excelent point t hitch hike from Riga to EUROPE!!!
Great spot. Cars can go quite fast but there is place on the bus stop. Probably not for trucks.
Great spot to Lithuania on Via Baltica.
Aldo the traffic was really low probably because of en early hour I've menage to get ride all the way to Riga pretty quickly

One male 40+, no sign, one big and one small backpacks, sunny and warm day. Going to Tallinn.
A lucky spot. A bus stop, good visibility.
I was dropped here by another driver and within 5 minutes a lorry stopped and took me all the way to Tallinn.
Good spot, I had a sign for Siaulai and got picked up quickly. The car was heading to Klaipeda so if you're going there this is also a solid spot

Got a ride to Jelgava after 10 minutes,from where I could hitchhike further to Lithuania. Since it's a bus stop right after a traffic light the cars have plenty of time to recognize you and there is enough space to stop

It was easy to get a ride from here to Cēsis.
Easy for cars to stop at the bus stop nearby
A bus stop. To Cēsis, Smiltene, Alūksne or further. Have never waited here more than 15min :)

Fairly good place to get out of the city towards East. The cars have space to stop, including trucks. If you stand after the traffic lights, drivers can also have more time to consider picking you up. To get there, take the bus 15 and get off in the bus stop "Pagrieziens uz dārziņiem" - it's the last one before the bus takes a turn off the road A6.
Good spot for cars to stop, direction to Riga. Never waited there longer than 20 mins. The road might be a bit empty during the middle of working days, though.
1st car i pass stoped, like taxi from sigulda to riga
Wass going toward daugavpils , only 5 min wait after my host droped me her !
Not a problem to get a ride towards Valmiera.
Nice spot with the parking, lots of cars are going to Valmiera. So, it wasn't a big problem toget a ride towards this town

Right after traffic lights there is plenty of space to stop the car and the speed there is quite low. Direction of Ogre, Daugavpils, Rēzekne. With a sign you can even get a ride in direction of Tallin.
Very easy to hitchhike to Cēsis.
A bus stop
2 minutes waiting and got a lift to the city centre!
A bus station, in front of a big supermarket. It took us less than 10min to get a ride straight to Riga!

took a bus from Riga to get here, it comes from the north before the junction. couldnt even get here, i got picked up even earlier as walking from the bus stop to this place on the connecting road from northeast direction

To Saldus, Skrunda, Liepaja. Direct way
to the western seaside of Latvia. Good
trafic, direct and fast cars. (Forgot to login for this spot)
Great spot.  Had a sign for Siauliai.  Waited about ten minutes max for a ride the distance.
excellent place for hitchhiking to jelgava (lv) or siauliai (lt)
A good place to get to Saulkrasti, because it is not far and people are nice here.
A nice bus stop, direction to Riga.
Bus stop. Direction Riga. Very good spot, even for trucks!
Better place here than in Liela iela street just around 600meters near. Drivers easier to see you and your direction
Been waiting for about 15min. an got a lift to the center of Riga
i was alone, it worked well!
Very popular hhing spot - you stay usualy not longer then 15 min, even if its full of hhikers:)
Towards Jūrkalne, Liepāja. A place for a car to stop and fairly easy to hitchhike in all seasons.
If going to Riga this is supprisingly a good spot in a bus stop "Kocenu kapi". Usually doesnt take long time.

There is a petrol station. There you can find a lift to Jekabpils, Daugavpils, Rezekne.
In this petrol station is a lot of cars.
To Jelgava, Riga. There is a bus stop.
Use this place very often, usually get picked up within 5minutes, although there were two times, I waited for 2 hours. But that was due to weather, I think

> Sigulda, Valmiera, Cesis, Valga

plenty of cars, many hitchhikers, not good to hh to Estonia though

Definitely best place if you are going to Talsi, Ventspils, Kuldiga, Tukums, Kandava. Take a train to Priedaine (15. min. from Riga) and then take a walk through pine wood (on the other side of station walk takes some 10 min.)
To Ventspils, Talsi, Tukums, Kuldiga. Wait for direct car here. Its beeter to mis some short-distance cars and then get one car till the goal of your trip
Here goes a bus nr 18 from center of Riga
There are many cars who goes to Ogre,Jekabpils,Daugavpils and Russia so it's very easy to hitchhike someone.This place is in bus stop.
Best way from Riga to EUROPE!!!
A perfect place to hhike to Liepaja from. :) its like from the books about best practice hhiking. :)
To Aizpute, Liepaja. Direct cars, slow speed, place to stop - what else do you need for succesfull hhiking?!
From Gulbene to Riga, Smiltene, Valmiera... Start near bus stop, easy and quickly! :)
From Gulbene to Madona, Plavinas...
From Gulbene to Balvi, Aluksne.
Very easy to get lift to Sigulda, lot of people going to Sigulda to shop or for family, stop is on bus stop very good place

Big truck parking area with cafe, free toilets (for truckers but nobody really cares, use the doors with truck signs) and I was told there is a shower for truckers, so perfect spot for you to get freshened up before asking all the truckers for their destinations, more trucks towards south than north, would recommend asking around here early in the morning or in the evening, during the daytime probably not the best spot, but you will get a long distance ride for sure here

It was two of us (guy and girl). We waited for 30 minutes on a Wednesday morning and got a direct ride to Riga on a truck. 
Great spot, cars drive slowly amd there is a huge space for cars and trucks to stop.

Great towards Ragana or Inciems direction, loads of cars with not so high speeds, decent visibility as well as actual bus stop so good for cars to stop, wouldnt try during the dark tho, as didnt seem to have much street lights around here, wait times of 5-20 minutes expected

One male 40+, with a sign "VILNIUS" , one big and one small backpacks, dry but cloudy day. Going to Vilnius.
A very good space. A bus stop, with enough space even for a truck, just after the entrance/exit to a petrol station. 8:45 in the morning. A perfect traffic, a car every 20-30 seconds. I barely started hitchhiking and a car stopped and took me to Bauska, where after 15 minutes I got another ride, all the way to Vilnius.
The only problem with this place is getting there. Before, from Riga
Towards Valka, anywhere along the road here will work, 50km/h and good visibility, lots of long distance cars, wait times of 5-20 minutes expected

Towards Strenci, perfect spot, very wide shoulder, one of the first cars will stop, be aware of very low traffic though, always works for me, I'd recommend going to Strenci and then head to Valka if you are going to Estonia, wait times of 5-25 minutes

Towards Smiltene, the map is incorrect as they moved the bus stop further and put there a speed camera, so it's 50km/h and a speed camera, therefore high likelyhood of getting a car. Also the sideroads from either direction get cars going to Smiltene/Riga etc so good chance to stop them also, wait times of 10-30 minutes expected
During low traffic times of the day you can just stand by the exit to the road to get probably one of the first cars to stop towards Smiltene, wait times of 5-15 minutes

Towards Smiltene, perfect spot, low speeds, good visibility and loads of long distance cars, a bus stop with shelter from the rain and streetlights etc, ideal. When you see Tramprennen 2024 stickers you know you are at the right spot, wait times of 5-15 minutes expected

Towards Litene/Gulbene/Aluksne. Amazing bus stop in city limits, after this there are roadworks (which take forever so you'll most likely still have them by the 26 so cars are even more willing to take a hitcher to avoid boredom, wait times of couple minutes to 10 minutes expected, can't get any better than that
Towards Karsava/Ostrov(RUS), amazing spot, just after the roundabout. There's enough space to stop a car with no worries, decent amount of traffic, wait times of 5-20 minutes expected

Towards Rezekne, even though the sideroad seems to be used just by locals, the cars turning will most likely due to 0 speed just stop for you and take you further, so far the only good spot near Daugavpils, here you'd get a car within 30 minutes

Towards LV, Daugavpils, the border is amazing. Due to the current events most of the lorries are headed on A13 to one of the Russian border points, which means that every lorry gets inspected by the border guards. Due to that all the normal cars that do use this crossing drive super slow, get stuck behind manouvering lorries etc, therefore they have super good visibility on you when u stand on the border, wait times of 5-20 minutes expected, most likely first personal car with any space will giv

Got a ride to Ainazi within 40 minutes with Parnu sign.

Altough I waited a bit more than I expected, I still consider it as a perfect spot - drivers can easily see you from decent distance, there is enough space for them to stop and there is even "official hitchhiking spot" sticker. Even if you have bad luck and cannot get any ride, you can wait for bus to Ainazi as a last resort.

There is a bus stop: "Neilandi", the bus 26 go there from city and across the road is the sign of RIGA.
Firstly I try to hitchhiking with the sign Vilnius but after 30 min with no result, I change the sing to Bauska. After this in 5 min one driver stopped and bring me to Bauska
A lot of cars going both directions. Waited with 2 fellow Polish hitchhikers, they had an "EST" sign. We got a direct ride to Tallinn in approximately 20 minutes.
Bus stop, good visibility, they still go slow and all traffic goes in one lane. Solo female, cloudy Sunday morning, thumb.
2nd car stoped directly to riga
Good place, there's a bus stop. after a crossroad so the cars go slow. We were 2 young people, no sign, sunny morning.

Amazing spot towards Riga direction, speed camera in 50km/h area just before the bus stop as well as the stop being itself very wide and comfortable for drivers to stop, wait times of 5-15 minutes expected
Small but good bus stop for getting out of Liepaja towards Grobina, good traffic flow, a traffic light before the bus stop, so cars go slow, wait times of 10-20 minutes expected

Towards Jelgava, great spot on the highway, just walk a bit further north from the bus station, seemed to be quite used one (people waiting there all the time for the local busses) but you can be before that, where a lane goes for the cars turning towards Medemciems, wait times of 10-20 minutes expected
Towards Valka/Valga. Got picked up after 10min to Strencin, I think it's not worth to walk up to the further intersection.
Got dropped off here and didn't want to walk to the other side of the city to continue towards Valmiera. Not too much traffic, but still works out perfectly fine.
Easy with a sign to get to Cesis, bus stop
Gas station + wide shoulder to pull over, towards ventspils

Good spot towards ventspils, also not much traffic after 7pm. Got picked by a truck driver going towards ventspils. Idk, maybe it's even possible to cross the ferry to Sweden with them if you ask kindly?
Shop along the road where some people stop and you could ask, and enough space to stop for the passing drivers to stop
best spot around
perfect spot wont take long
Best spot to get out of walka, got lucky 1st ride to cesis
bus stop direction valmiera

Bus stop
Cars are not going fast because it's right at the end of a speed control area
And you've got a little nice walk around the swamp next to this place
Amazing spot. Caught a ride on Sunday morning in 15 min! Cars don’t go too fast and there is enough space for them to stop.
Amazing spot. Cars don’t go too fast and have enough place to park on the bus station. Were picked up by the local.

Towards Kekava, south etc, great spot, don't bother walking til roundabout, there's virtually no place for cars to stop but instead use the bridge, it is very wide at where the other road goes under from it, you will get a car within 5-20 minutes

Towards Vecpiebalga, Madona. Good traffic, slow speeds due to turn, no cars in parking lot so might not be as used anymore. The bus stop is wide enough for car to stop comfortably, wait time to be expected 10-25 minutes
Very wide bus stops and pitstop area for cars on both sides, very good visibility, decent traffic, with a lot of cars going quite some distance, wait time of 5-20 minutes
Towards the Estonian border

Nice straight road towards Tukums, not too much traffic but also not too little, so you can stop cars just fine without worrying about the shoulders too much, got a ride within 5 minutes, you can take a bus to Tuški and just walk a bit, it's a cityline from Jelgava, and follows Dobele's road for quite some time
Nice bus stop after the roundabout with speeds low, great for Kekava, wait time of 10-20 minutes
Good spot for going northbound, slow traffic due to roundabout, poorly maintained during winter but always have gotten a ride within 10-20 minutes
Anywhere south of Salacgriva, direction south, is good, don't be afraid to get local cars, as for now the construction of Salacgriva bridge makes traffic come in convoys, wait time 5-30 minutes
A bit awkward bus stop, direction Smiltene, lots of cars tho and eventually within 10-35 minutes you'll get your ride

Towards Lejasciems, little traffic, but people pick you up fast, south of here is old soviet nuclearbase, very cool spot to explore, during summertime might meet some tourists in there too, wait time of 5-15 minutes
Going towards Zeltini, the town's main bus stop, speeds are slow and the stop is of decent length, traffic is low, but 1st to 3rd car will pick you up, wait time of 5-15 minutes

Good visibility, nice straight part of the road, good for going towards Alsviki or Strautini, lots of local cars, a bit uncomfortable for drivers but they pick you up here fast, wait time of 5-20 minutes
Nice little road joining the main road, since in the middle of nowhere drivers pick you up more easily,great for southbound but traffic is low, wait time of 5-20 minutes

Very nice spot for going to Aluksne, not too much traffic (I am not sure if they have finished roadwork yet- it feels the road has been in construction for at least a year by now) but still people take it, slow speeds, wait time of 5-15 minutes
Very wide road, good spot for either direction, wait time of 5-20 minutes
To south on a bit muddy shoulder, however speeds arent that high yet, will get a car within 20 minutes
Spot for Riga. Lake is good for swim
Cars go fast but they can see you from far away. There are some place to stop. Find a nice girl who pick me up
Is it not a real highway, cars can stop on the side to pick you up. On the way to tallin.

I will give 5 Stars to this spot because I got a car directly to Vilnius 220 km in a raining day and it was 5 pm !!! Cars didn't want to stop and trucks didn't have enough room to pull over, but a lady from Russia safe me that day !!! She invited me to eat and invited me a beer too ! And took me directly to my friend place in Vilnius even when she wasn't going to Vilnius! I was extremely lucky that day ! I was even thinking about camping in that place and it was already cold ❄️ so, once again! I
Probably got lucky with the first car stopping. Most cars going to Ergli
Got a ride close to the border to Lithuania after less than 5 minutes :) it's a bus stop on the road that goes directly to Lithuania so I think with a LT sign you would get a ride there very easily
Good spot to get to the main road from the beach. A lot of traffic on the weekend.

Got a ride to Sigulda almost instantly
Plenty of cars going here and there is room for cars to stop
Plenty of cars going to Cēsis
Good spot for both directions, cars going slow and there is a lot of place for them to stop.
Lot of cars from Finland or Estonia. Great spot to get a ride to Tallin. Lower traffic but no trucks, only cars.
Perfect spot to hitch south. Bus stop with plenty of space, low speeds,, good visibility etc.
got a ride to the next town where cars drive slower.
Good spot, a bit of walking from the bus stop is so worth it
Good spot, lots of space to stop. Got a ride to Iecava in minutes.
Enough space after the roundabout. We first declined ride after 1 minute to Iecava but after 20 minutes second car offered the same, so we went. Good decision. Good accessibility by public transport

Good spot (visibility, car speed, stopping option), didnt have the best luck though, declined one lift to Iecava (30mins in) and took the bus to Bauska instead after an hour. If you want to go to Kaunas I'd expect the bus stop a bit further down the road (Cagas) to be better, as a lot of traffic (~75% on a Tue @ 3pm)  is going to Baldone instead of going to the highway.
Very good spot for southbound, cars are slow, 2 lanes, wait times are never longer than 15 minutes, even at dark, lots of traffic
A lot of cars and truck, good spot
Perfect spot to get direct ride to Parnu/Tallin. Just ask around as there are a lot of Estonians - the second guy I asked gave me a lift to Parnu.
Got quite lucky

Don't get fooled by the name, but actually it's a mainhub with cars going both directions to Riga or to Estonia, more likely towards Estonia since all the locals from Pärnu county buy their alcohol from here, wait time 20 minutes, good til 10pm
Good spot, easy to go to Valmiera

Plenty of cars coming out of Cēsis.
Got a ride to Liepa quite fast
Sign ''Bauska'' will be fastest than ''Ķaunas'' or ''Panevezys''
Good spot to catch a car, speed not fast
A bus stop just after a traffic light. Cars coming from Dienvidu bridge can have a good look at you while standing at the red light.

Long strip of gravel on the side of the road, even unsure drivers can take their time to think and stop (mines stopped a couple of hundred meters forward, almost didn't see them). Sign Kaunas, got ride to Kaunas. Solo female, Sunday morning.
Cars are driving slow and there was enough traffic. Also, enough room to stop. A van stopped and took me to Kaunas from here.
After almost 2 hours of waiting we've got ride to Warsaw. There's a lot of cars and they drive slowly, but a little goes to Lithuania and further

Didn't get a ride in 50 minutes. Lot of locals. Enough place to pull over but trucks speed up there so difficult for them to stop (by the super market and Chinese restaurant). I moved 200m to the petrol station and got a ride from a truck in 10min.

Direction: Lithuania (Kaunas, Vilnius), Poland

Bauska is a small city so it's easy to reach this end on foot.
Not bad spot, go as close to lights as possible, the car going slow, there is place to stop. Almost every car go to Riga, people are very kind and speak English
Was raining, 4 pm, not the best placeto stop but still Find a ride to Riga
good place for going to south. a lot of german/polish/lithuanian car numbers. also a lot of place to stop for a car, since it s a bus stop
Very safe and easy to reach spot. Many cars going to LT direction Klaipēda and Palanga

very good spot
cars have a lot of space to stop
also a lot of cars going straight to tallinn/pärnu
The place is quite dangerous because there are dangerous  people and vagrants around.
Cars go fast, but pretty possible to get a ride here. I recommend to go to a better place on A1 highway if you wanna go to Tallinn.
Small gas stadion, yet very conviniently lopatek if you wanto go to Tallin/Pärnu.
Good spot, lots of traffic, had a EST sign with me.
Pretty good spot, got ride direct to Tallin.
From this point we traveled to Vitruve (65 km)
Not the best spot Buti gotta nice ride to the highway.
doesn’t exist anymore, if you take the bus continue to Kekava, so easy to get a ride there
In 2022 the highway is in renovation so this spot wasn't there when I went there. I still found an okay spot 200m after a temporary roundabout and got a ride in 5 minutes to buska.
I got a car after 30 minutes. There is a bus stop and cars go slow. Good spot for going to Lithuania.

THE BEST place if you are heading towards KAUNAS or POLAND. I got a ride after 4 minutes (a latvian driver took me to Kaunas). Nice and safe place, as cars are going slowly because of the traffic lights! :] www.nincsmese.com
definitely the best place if you want to go south!
We got picked up quickly, there are lots of cars going to Valga
This place is a very good spot if you want to go to Tartu, I just rose my thumb and a car stopped to take us.

Someone working for the Valmiera municipality dropped me there. There is an intercity bus stop direction Valka. There wasn't so much traffic so taking the bus could be a last solution. It's like 2 € but it is very slow (more than 1 hour for less than 50 km) and you are dropped at some kilometers from Valga in Estonia.
To Valka, Tartu. A lot of cars going this direction - its only one road:)

Indeed ideal spot for going basically anywhere towards Riga or major cities in Latvia, as well as even further south, wide enough bus stop to have a lorry stop, decent street lights for the darker times, okay amount of traffic, wait times of 10-25 minutes expected

Since this is my hometown i can surely say this is the best place to hitchhike to Valmiera or Riga from Valka. Usually takes less than 30min here. No sign required since this road takes you only to big cities.
You could make three trucks stop here, the spot is giant, i didn't waited long to continue to an other random bus stop on the way to Aizpute
Cars to Aizpute and Kuldiga. Hitchhike on the bus stop. Speed of  cars if low after a turn, so more time to react on you for the driver.:)
Car took us to varakļani in less than 5min. theres a lot of traffic and cars go slow from roundabout. has a bus stop to stop cars.
20 -30 min with big sign RIGA, no problem.
To Riga. Not the best position, but I've  never stayed longer then 20 min here. If you are standing more, so change your position - in about 2 km theris a big junction - try there.
Good spot, quite some trafic and a lot of place to stop

Towards Kuldīga, may be possible to get a ride to Liepāja as well.
This side of the road has lots of space for many kilometres for cars to stop. Waiting time depends, I have hitched a ride in both 10 minutes and 1 hour.
Good spot at the traffic lights to catch cars going to Lithuania. People drive slowly and only 1 lane, everyone can see you and consider.
14.06.2019 - I waiting there about 15min and found a ride till Kaunas

I used to wait at this red light, after taking a bus out of Riga till Bauska bus terminal. At this spot, I would try to find Polish trucks stopping at the red light, directly run towards them and ask them with signs to take me. They usually respond, and I just get the time to climb on the truck before the light gets green.

IMPORTANT UPDATE: Now there is a normally functioning gas station, so cars no longer can stop at the exit ramp.

You can still try your luck and ask around at the gas station but it seems like mostly locals use this one and traffic is a bit small. After asking around for 45 minutes got ride to gas station near Varzas.
Walked here and got a ride with a local man.
Cars go fast, haven't had much luck here myself compared to other reviews, it's definitely not a spot to be when its dark, otherwise i have gotten a ride here usually within 50-90 minutes

*excellent* spot. easy to reach by bus. the speed limit is 80km/h, so cars aren't too fast. 
there's enough space for them to stop (on an exit ramp to an abandoned gas station).
also, easy and safe to stand next to the motorway, and cars can see you from a distance. 
got a ride all the way to tallinn literally within 15mins.

Traffic is crazy. Cars dont have much space to stop there but if they decide to they can handle it. It was worth walking this far. I took a bus from Riga to Ādaži. An Estonian truck driver gave me a ride.
Easier to stay on the main road that asked in gas station. There are place for a car to stop. Find a ride to Tallin without sign
We (2 people) were kicked out of the petrol station and waited just after. Got taken by a truck towards Estonia.
Lots of local traffic, altough this is the main road to Estonia. Sign with 'Ainazi' got us a ride in the end.
it s not looking like a place for a car but i stopped a truck to Tallin .D waited 30min...
Got a ride to the border with an "EST" sign. Pretty high speeds do trucks won't stop for sure but still works. Getting to here by bus from Riga very easy.
Seems like a good spot but didn't work for me. After waiting almost 1 hour with sign Parnu, I got eventually a short ride to gas station nearby Adazi.

very good very nice spot
highly recommend

Good spot for direction north considering the road and intensity of it, i stand usually just before the bus stop and the storeway, also good at night time, nice lights, usual wait time of 5-30 minutes
Maybe I was greedy, but finding a car to Estonia was almost impossible. Not really advised, but I believe this is the best place going north from Riga.

Got near here with a bus from the city centre (it’s also possible to take it for free, if you dare). The first car I approached was an Estonian number plated car, but they were heading to Tartu, if I didn’t have a plan to visit my grandma first, I would’ve went with them, but I needed to go towards Ikla. So I fortunately found a woman driving to Ādaži.
We hadn't even gotten out of the previous car yet, when a guy at the gas station offered us to take us further.
THE place to start if you like to ask in fuel station. Bus1 till you see the lake. The 2nd drive was the good one.

We weren't so lucky (two guys), so stood here on the bus stop for an hour without any result, although it's enough place to stop and cars go slowly (our distination was Riga). Went back to the city and took the night bus to Riga (4 hours and 10 euros).
I started from her to go to moscow but been droped by next city by the rail crossing at ludza , 30 min of wait from 9:10 to 9:40 am of course !
got a lucky fast straight shot to Moscow during Russian winter hilidays (almost no trucks until Jan 9th)
Excellent for hitchhiking day and night towards Riga, St.Petersburg,Moscow or Lithuania.
Didn’t work with a sign, had to talk to people. Quite a lot of people tho, technically it’s a good spot (Male, young, 60L backpack)
Waited with an EST sigh for about 15 minutes and got a ride straight to Tallin.

We hitch-hiked here because somebody was going to Saulkrasti from Riga and offered to drop us there. I was a bit sceptical at first but we ended up finding a ride pretty quickly after asking around for about 10 minutes.
The next driver drove us (2 w/ big bag packs) straight to Tallinn.
I think we got lucky but there seems to be at least some traffic on weekdays.
Good spot on papr, but suprisingly low amount of trafic
All cars going to Poland or further come through here at a slow speed. A good place to get off if your driver is not going at least till Kaunas.
spent 3 hours here at the evening of Sunday trying to get to Kaunas. Finally gave up and went to Daugavpils.
Although the road was quite empty, we only had to wait a couple of minutes until a car stopped and took us all the way to Riga.

This is a good spot to get a ride to Riga or to Lithuania.
It is possible to hitch trucks, which go to Europe.
A lot of cars (most of them to Bauska and riga) and trucks (frequently to Tallin and poland). I caught a nice man who went to Ukraine, and left me in warsaw. One of the best spot Nearby riga
Good spot for catching cars going south, as you avoid most local traffic around Riga. We got a ride to bauska in 30 minutes, from where we got to LT.

such a big luck here
waited for literally 10 seconds
Okay place since cars go slowly. Possible to get a ride to Lithuania.
Cars go fast, but one American guy in rented car braked bit crazily on this bus stop, I guess we got a bit lucky too.
Towards Riga, it's fine spot, cars are actually a bit slower here, the bus stop isnt the biggest here tho, wait time of 20-30 minutes

One male 40+, no sign, one big and one small backpacks, sunny day. Going to Tallinn.
After waiting for over 1,5 hours at a different bus stop a few hundred metres down the road and not having luck. I moved to this bus stop. It had more space to stop than the previous one. A bit on a curve, but good visibility.
Within half and hour two women took me about 40 kms closer to Tallinn and left me on another bus stop where I got quickly got a ride directly to Tallinn.
5min

Cars to Saldus, Riga, Aizpute, Kuldiga. There is a bus stop nearby and a place for drivers to stop. You can get here from Liepaja by taking a bus Nr. 912 from the centre of the city (near hotel "Liva").
Small road, It is easy to catch a car
To Sigulda, Riga. A lot of cars, high speed, but you are visible from the distance and there is a place to stop.
Bus stop, get a lift to the road to Sigulda
1st car stoped, 5 minutes of waiting
To Valmiera, Riga. In the night its better to stay her, but during the day you can also try to change position, if you are waiting for a lift for 30 min.
to Malpils. best results for hitchiking at 5-7pm on in the morning because people return from work. direct cars. if they'll take you, most probably will get you all the way
Very good , only 2 min wait to go to reznek !
take a minibus to lociki, get off when you see a lonely traffic light (bus stop is called "svetafor"). should get both city and transit traffic. can be a bit windy.
To Kaunas, Vilnius

If you are trying to get to Kolkas rags, you might need to wait quite a long while and it may take quite a few cars (this is true hitchiking almost anywhere along this road), but the cars are likely to stop for you. When I hitchikek I didn't have the sign and ended up getting short rides and in the end took a bus too to get to the spot...

Direction - Riga. The spot is good, but the problem is that the traffic is scarce. (1 car per 5min on Saturday afternoon)
At least there is a good chance that the 1st car will stop.
I was heading to RIGA, after 1 hour of waiting time 2 French girls picked me up with their home made caravan! A bit embarrassing place, but good one! :)
To Riga. Standart hhiking point. Traffic not so big, but enough for hhiking 24 hours a day
All the following ~500 m are very suitable for hh here. It is still the city, so speed is rarely very high.
I was hitchhiking at night and I waited for 2 hours:( But for my view this places looks good: lighted, after railway crossing (so cars are slow).

I hitchhiked further on to Tallinn from here. It took me some time untill I got a ride though. Few days earlier I got dropped off from a truckdriver at this spot. He was going to Tallinn, so I would assume that long distance drivers to further north would take that route.
You could walk here from city centre. Not great position, a lot of traffic, not much space for drivers. Waited 30 min. and walked ahead 100 meters. There got a ride in 20 min. (Time: about 3 p.m.)
Bus stop at the roundabout exit, direction Panevežys.
A good place to hitchhike to Valka and futher to Estonia.

A bus stop there, you can start to hitchhike to Smiltene from there. The best place since all the cars have just turned from and haven't gained any speed. Depending on the time of the day, the traffic can be low sometimes.
A good place to get a ride to Riga. Just after the roundabout where the cars are still slow.
It's a good place, but there may be not so much traffic. So everything depends on how lucky you are.
To Daugavpils. As I remember, I've never wait here longer then half hour. Usualy it was direct cars to Daugavpils
Good place for going toward Daugavpils.
Might be a good place to go toward Belarus. It would be quite easy to find a car just to cross the border. Some luck is required to catch a longer ride.
Bus stop. Direction Riga. Maybe not the best spot, because not so much traffic, but still I got a ride to the main road A10 in Kandava after a reasonable waiting time.

I think we were lucky because we got a straight lift from here to Kaunas in only 10 mins and there wasn't too much traffic at 6 or 7pm. Anyway I think it's better to take a bus from Riga to Bauska (2,15LVL) because to my experiences it's easier to get rides from smaller cities.
It took us a while getting to Kaunas from there. There is a bus stop where cars can easily stop.
I don't know if it was luck but a couple heading to Kaunas (LT) took me after 3min :)
On liela iela, after the roundabout, in front of the Saules Veikals : good spot to go to Lithuania and getting on the A13
not many cars, but it seems everyone is willing to pick you !
Somewhere here is a bus stop and it is realy easy to hhike from here to LT and then to Poland.
Waited maybe 10min. and a car stopped and took me to a better place between A5 and A8 intersaction.
Keramika
Like mentioned we (two people) went to a gas station and picked up a truck going to Kaunas. we needed to Vilnius but still it took us more then 100 KM.
I dont remeber exatcly the Gas station we went to but it was a bit before this small town.
There is a petrol station. There you can talk to the drivers and get a car to Ogre (it is name of the town), Jekabpils, Daugavpils.
There is a bus stop.
To Kandava, Kuldīga, Talsi, Ventspils.
Very good place - can get there from Valmiera by foot or by taking city bus. If using bus - 40 santims is the cost of ticket.
I stoped 2nd car.
To Biksti (road A9). enough local cars to hhike. Be patient.:)
Get here with a bus from Daugavpils bus station and use thse sigh LT or even PL. I always get ride in less than 2 minutes (depends on traffic)

Sometimes it's better to hitchhike without sign here and go to Brocēni. There you can hichike with a sign, because there are more drivers coming out of Saldus.

I suggest you to stand after road cmin out of Neste. A lot of drivers stop there and after a meal they are more possibility they will lift you.
To Riga. If you didn't manadge to find a lift on gas station - here you can stay and cover also a traffic both from Liepaja and Saldus in direction Riga
Bus to Ādaži is probobly the easyest way.
Bit messy to get here. But good spot for Tallinn.
A bus stop. Direction Talsi, Ventspils. The cars approach fairly fast but it's usually no problem getting a ride in 15 minutes since the driver can see you hitchhiking from afar.
Here cars already took some speed so its better to go back closer to the bridge.
To Ventspils, Talsi, Tukums, Kuldiga. If the previous pint is heavyly ocupied by hhikers - try to hhike here. Sometimes its even faster to get a ride from here
To Daugavpils, Rezekne, Russia. 2 years ago it was a very good place for hhiking, but now, due to reconstructions, it could change a bit

> Riga

right in the middle of nowhere, we got a ride in a couple of minutes! just stay at the bus stop there
From Liepaja to Nica(LV), Rucava(LV), Palanga (LT) and Klaipeda(LT). A good trafic in the mornings and evenings - direct cars :)
To Saldus, Skrunda, Liepaja. Direct way to the western seaside of Latvia. Good trafic, direct and fast cars.
To avoid going in to Riga - you can try to hhike from here in direction to Tallinn or Russia. A lot of tranzit trucks is going by this way.
To Dobele: direct and fast cars :)
Good place to hhike after you eat something in the cafe nearby.:) Speed of cars is slow, a lot of place to stop a car and also a parking place near cafe where you can find a lift directly to Liepaja
in the daytime its better to stay here, but in the night better to hhike before a bridge (because of streetlights)
To Pavilosta, Jurkalne  and Ventspils. The road is not overloaded with cars, but here you can have a better chanse to get a lift, than in Grobina.
To Kuldiga. Not so many cars, but they often stops very fast here.
To Sabile, Tukums, Jurmala and Riga. Even  if the speed of cars seems to be very high - you are visible here from a distance and drivers stop their car.:)
To Kuldiga. A lot of cars going there. hhike after a boarder of a vilage Renda.
To Sabile, Talsi, Tukums, Riga. Just wait here for the car you need. Do not walk for a better position, because you will walk around 10-12 km
To Kuldiga. In the end of Sabile, you will find a place where its possible to stop a car for driver. Just hhike there.:)
To Kandava, Tukums, Riga. In the end of Sabile, befor the sign. enough place to stop a car. Do not go futher, there is only hills and quite dangerous road.
To Sabile, Kuldiga. Just stay infront of a bus station and a car will arrive:)
To Tukums, Riga. In the end of Kandava. Speed is low enough to stop a car:)
To Kandava, Sabile, Kuldiga. Hhike on the bus stop and soon you will get a lift
To Tukums, Riga. Stay on the bus stop - you are visible here. Car will arrive soon! :)
A good place to hhike to Liepaja: slow speed, right turn, bus stop - almost ideal:)
To Tukums. After a raildoad there is a bus stop - what could be better? :)
To Riga. A lot of cars, a lot of local cars also. It looks like ther is no place to stop, but drivers do it:)
To Jelgava. Stay on the bus stop and hhike. Car will appears:)
To Riga. A lot of trafic here. Stay on the bus stop and you will defenatly get a lift directly to Riga.
To Kuldiga, Talsi, Ventspils. A lot of cars, enough place to stop, slow speed.
To Tukums, Talsi, Kuldiga, Ventspils. A lot of cars going this directions and very often direct ones.
To Riga. Slow speed because of a turn, but many local cars which go only few km.
To Tukums (road A10). Slow speed of cars. Not so many of them, but enough to hhike.
To Zalenieki, Tervete.  You can start to hhike here. Many local cars, so write down your destination goal.
To Riga, Tukums. Enough cars to hhike on this road.:) Be patient.
To Liepaja. Stay on the bus stop and write down your destination. Car will appears:)
To Liepaja. Good traffic in the mornings and evenings.
To Kuldiga. In summertime a lot of cars go here. In winter only locals.
To Ventspils. The road could be empty, but wait a bit and your car will appears:)
To Valmiera, Tartu (EST). Its quite dangerous to stop a car here, but a lot of drivers do it. If you are against dangerous hhiking - walk 3km to a next spot.
To Valmiera, Tartu (EST). Somewhere here you can try to hhike mo saftly. There are some hills, so try to hhike on the top of a hill. Speed is 70 km/h for the cars.
To Valmiera, Tartu (EST). Ther is a bus stop, so hhike here. You are visible from a distance and there is a place for stop a car
To Riga. Usually I'm hhiking here, when I'm returning from Estonia. But mayby its not the best point to start to hhike from Valmiera. Time of waiting is not more then 25 min.
To Tallinn. A lot of cars all day long (and night also), most of them are direct cars to Estonia or Finland
To Riga. If you want to go to Riga and your car is going to Estonia (for exmple), you can jump out here and easely hitchhike a new direct one.:)
To Balvi, Gulbene. The road is not overloaded with trafic, but when some cars appears they usually take you. Be patient.
To Riga, to Gulbene, to Balvi. Local cars, in the mornings a lot of them are going to Riga
To Riga. In the mornings there are a lot of cars going direction to Riga. Write down on a Plate and you will not stay here more then 20 min.
To Smiltene. Write down your aim and a first car going this direction will take you :)
To Vecpiebalga. You can ask people on a parking place near cafe, but they usualy have no place in the cars (family holidays). So just wait after parking and your car will appears.:)
To Riga. Good traffic.:)

to Dobele, to Tukums. Somewhere here there is a bus stop, so try to hhike htere. Write down your destination. You you don't have a lift in half an hour - change position. In 1,5 km there is a crossroad - try there:)
To Riga, Ventspils, Kuldiga. Just after traficlights, there is a busstop. You can hhike before it.
just stand at the bus stop, good traffic. but you need to get there by car
From Salacgriva to Riga (VIA Baltica road, quite good and easy).
not bad HH point... cars are very fast but maybe you can catch somebody who living shopping center to your way .P also enough place for cars... you can come here with airport bus from city center...
don t try to go Salacgriva from this road... it looks like shortcut but after some km road going to worst... you can see some car who choice this road but they re going their home...
There is a good place to hitchike to Riga because cars go from Daugavpils and Rezekne.There ir evry good traffic especially in Sunday.

Ride to Riga, Kuldiga, Ventspils.You can ask somebody to drop you off under the bridge witch is better place to go to Riga some 5 km from here. Spot is reachable by walking some 10/15 min. from center.

Ride to Riga, Tukums, Jelgava. Best early in the working day mornings you will easly get ride to Riga used it for years. Sunday is a bad day normaly. Harder to get here from Talsi ask somebody to drop you off on the bridge (tilts in latvian) they will get your point if you will show them your Riga sign.
I have started to hitchhike from here(at night, 18:00 7Nov). Place has light from lamps, after a petrol station. Close to Riga's centr.

This place has no lamps, so it's difficult to hitchike there at night. Cars from wast are goimg rather fast. So generally, it not perfect place but if take into consideration that all places around 100km are worse, my mark for it is "good".
Truck parking for lorries headed towards Estonia, would recommend coming here early in the morning from Riga and talk with the drivers, other times probably not so great

Towards the ring road and Strenci/Valka direction, good for dark times as this spot has great street lights, got offers for any of the Rujiena and Mazsalaca directions as well as cars going towards Valka but definitely lesser of them than the other two. Still the wait times are not so bad as people will understand you want to skip Valmiera, wait times of 20-40 minutes to be expected
Towards Glažškunis, fine bus stop, good visibility, loads of locals so don't expect a long distance ride, speeds are high but people willing to stop, wait times of 15-30 minutes expected
Towards Glažškunis, decent amount of traffic, around here city limits end so cars would speed up after that, wait times of 10-30 minutes expected, a lot of locals

Towards Kegums/Linde, beware dirtroad(!), but still gets a bit of traffic, wouldn't advise trying it, but you can get a ride within 20 minutes from Vecumnieki to further, would avoid anytime it is getting darker, but locals and others do take this shortcut road towards Kegums so you can get lucky
Towards Vecumnieki, little traffic, but slow speeds, you can hitch anywhere in Skaistkalne, wait times of 5-25 minutes expected
Towards Baltinava, medium to little traffic, best bet is to try to catch cars turning from Tilža road, good visibility, not suitable for the dark, wait times of 30-60 minutes expected

Towards Karsava/Ostrov(RUS), a very long and wide bus stop, however a lot of cars speed like crazy around here, not suitable for the dark, wait times of 20-50 minutes, not the highest amount of traffic
Not a lot of cars but it was also getting darker since it was already 20:45. generally not a bad spot. Bus station with roof, right after the town so the cars are not so fast.

Direction Daugavpils. Cars all ~2 minutes but the road is more straight to the direction of vilnius so i assume some cars will go. My ride only takes me a few kilometers ahead. But stop is right bevore a turn so some cars even slow down a bit but there is no roof at the bus station.
locals, should be quite easy anywhere on the road
Good spot on a bus stop. The only con is barriers that limit visibility, so you have to be on the stop, not the sidewalk. Got a ride to Valmiera.
Good spot I think, but we waited for one hour. A lot of people smiled at us,  but almost nobody stop.

Towards Durbe, Skrunda, decent enough speeding lane from gas station, the gas station also had lots of foreign lorries, so you might want to try your luck there in the early mornings, otherwise just hitch the cars from the road, wait times of 20-50 minutes expected depending on the time of the day

Very good wide bus stop towards Liepaja, good visibility, traffic is quite low, a lot of tourists with full cars, wait times of 10-40 minutes expected, wouldn't agree with the other reviewers, not that much traffic in the evenings

Small road towards Zagare, little traffic but cars are likely to stop, you can also stand anywhere on this road, doesn't really matter, wait times of 5-30 minutes expected depending on the time of the day
Not really much space to stop, but drivers won't care and stop anyway bc the road is mostly empty. Good towards ventspils.
Plenty of cars driving slowly due to traffic jam. Heading northwards out of the highway. Eventually got a ride to Saulkrasti from a Czech driver.
Thumbed up by the side of the road, got quickly a ride away from the city.

I thought there was no need to go to the next bus stop so i stayed here.
First car went to Riga, put me where i wanted and i ended with food, drinks and ice cream 😅
So i was very lucky, 'cause there are not a lot of cars going by

Towards Ezere, pretty fine bus stop, also almost nonused road before it, you can stand there and try to get cars to stop to bus stop, okay to low traffic density so beware, wait time of 10-30 minutes expected, you can check out what's left of the old Kursiši school meanwhile
Towards Ezere, not really a real spot but just a good road since low traffic, you can stand by the road, just walk past guardrails if you come from Kursiši, wait time of 5-20 minutes

Towards Plavinas, fine traffic, during dark times you gotta be awkwardly close to roundabout due to poor lighting, otherwise there is very wide side just after roundabout where cars stop, better at daytime, wait time of 10-30 minutes during daytime, at evening probably expect around a hour of wait

Towards Gaujiena, mostly locals from nearby villages that use this, since speeds are slow on this dirtroad and good visibility you will be probably picked up very fast by first or second car, wait time of 5-25 minutes expected

The only decent spot when headed north from Skriveri is here, long bus stop, there's a curve before tho so beware that drivers don't have longest of time to make decision, but speeds are slow, some cars use this road to get from a6 to p80, so you can still catch rides to Riga, wait time of 15 minutes
Lots of traffic, but a lot of them still go to Riga or nearby, also very inconvenient for cars to stop, but the rides are coming pretty decently 10-30 minutes
To north, spot is good since you can catch both ways of cars coming from A6, poorly maintained during winter and not doable at night, during daytime wait time of 20-30 minutes

Good stop to HH south ⬇️ ! I didn't ask at the gas station! I saw many trucks from Poland there ! I don't like to ask at the gas station at least I am extremely rush hahaha but I think here is the best spot ! Just take a local bus to arrive from the bus terminal for 1.75 euros
People can stop at the bus stop, if you stand at the entry.
Objectively a shitty Spot, almost no space for cars to stop - somehow still catched a ride to Tallinn in 5 Minutes. I think its good when theres not so much traffic.
This spot is on a bus stop, where can stop. Traffic is fast. At first we wanted to go to Pärnu in Estonia but after 25 minutes we stopped car to Valga.
Not that many cars going here, but got a ride to Ogre soon enough
Not a perfect place, cars going fast, but they can see you for a long time and there is a bus stop nearby for them to stop. After 10 min we got a ride to Tallin, with “Ainazi” sign.

Ask some people on the camping ground if they can take you. A lot of German people are there also a few Poish people. You get a ride easily also it's a quite inexpensive camping. Just 9 € (2014) for a night with a tent, showeres and toiletts.
To Kolka. Few cars but likely that someone will stop in less than 30min
Not that many cars but traffic is slow, you are visible and and there is a space to stop

At/in front of a busstop, just after traffic lights. Good visible for cars, good place to stop. 
In direction of Riga. With sign "Riga" waited for 15 mins. A lot of people go straight to Riga.

One male 40+, with a sign "VILNIUS" , one big and one small backpacks, dry but cloudy day. Going to Vilnius.
A very good space. A bus stop, with enough space even for a truck to squeeze in. Just before 9 in the morning. A perfect traffic, a car every 20-30 seconds. A van stopped after 15-20 minutes of waiting and took me all the way to Vilnius.
I got to this spot walking from the centre of Bauska.

Here is a good spot because drivers have space for stopping. I stayed there with the sign : PANEVEZYS that vice-versa was VILNIUS, after 20 minutes of waiting one  truck driver stopped when I showed sign PANEVEZYS, after he saw another side of my paperboard, he said that he could move me to Vilnius, and we go nice.
Good spot, we walked from the town to this bus stop. Lot of traffic. Suprisingly a truck driver took us to Panavežys

I got almost stuck here!!! big trucks "never" will stop !!! They don't have room for that ! Small cars only ! It was raining and a lady took me only 8 km 😅 hahaha  at least the other one had a little more room for cars to stop !
Small bus stop for cars to stop. semi's won't stop there. Got super lucky and got picked up by two girls that were going to concert in Warsaw
We had no luck on this spot. Cars stop to shop there, which is very confusing. Not a good place to get to Estonia, many locals.
Not a very good spot because cars drive fast and there is three differents lines though there is a nice place to stop for them.
AWESOME place if you wanna go towards Pärnu or Tallinn!

Heading to Tartu, Estonia. I would suggest to rather have a 'Valmiera' sign than 'Sigulda' as the roads divide. And even, try directly Estonia because the traffic on the road till Tartu was very calm !

this is the best place to go out from riga to tallinn, tartu,pskov. i waited 20min
 you cann get there with the tram 6. you have to get down of the tram at the last stop, and then walk like 10min.
The only place to stay if you want to get to Riga-Pleskau highway
To Pape. Lots of Lithuanian tourists during the summer. Almost everyone with a free space stops, probably because it is a gravel road and you look desperate standing or walking there :D
Cars drive by quite fast, but the hard shoulder is nice and wide and visibility excellent. Got a ride in no time from here to Klaipeda.
Palanga is in Lithuania, please correct:)
To Lithuania, Poland. Cars appears every 4 min., more often in the mornings and evenings:)
Take buses 4 or 32 to this spot. They leaving from center 13. janvāra iela (13th January street). HH next to the highway near the bus stop.
From Riga to Saldus, Skrunda, Liepaja. Till this point u can get by minibus (from Riga's centre) which goes to PINKI or SKULTE. Write down LIEPAJA and u won't stay longer than half an hour.

From Riga to Saldus, Skrunda, Liepaja.
Till this point u can get by minibus
(from Riga's centre) which goes to PINKI
or SKULTE. Write down LIEPAJA and u
won't stay longer than half an hour. (forget to login for the previous spot)
Solo female, cloudy Sunday morning. Local traffic, but good enough to get past the roundabout and go south instead of walking.
Ok spot to head south, some local traffic or only going to nearby villages. Took a minibus to near here from Riga for 1€
People in their cars look very confused, like they don't know what you want from them. Mostly local people.
Works well, watch out for the trucks driving on high speed. Waited 15min in a Friday evening, got a ride to Riga.
It took me about 1 hour to wait, yeah cars are going waaaaayyy to fast, but luckily I go a lift to Riga
To Saldus and Riga. There is a bus stop (usualy empty), but speed of cars is very offen too high to stop immediatly. So be ready to run a bit after the car stops. :)

Riga-Tallinn (2person f/m)
We waited there for 2,5h and even though it rained we didn't get a ride! In the end we took the train back to riga and then the bus to Tallinn ^^

Very very low traffic, cars must stop on the on-ramp and block it for a while, but they go very slow after they turn and have a lot of time to decide if they wanna take you. Waited one evening about one hour, then decided to go to see the sea instead and tried the next day, waited about 15 min and got a ride to Tallinn.
Drivers are reluctant to stop at the ramp and there's not a lot of traffic. Eventually, got a  short ride to a better spot.

The access ramp to the motorway is quite long, so you can hitchhike here, but do so behind the safety rail and make sure you are seen. Otherwise I found a ride to Estonia really quickly, about 10 minutes.

I was taken quite fast, it's ok
No sign, as usual
You must aim for Grobina first
But the spot don't looks nice, a lot of people, and it's the only road, so lot of people turn left, to deal with that you can walk 20mins to another bus stop after the cross
But it's not terrible because finaly, people going straight are on the right side of the road
Not so good expierience here. Normally cars took me to Grobina or Durbe where there where better spots. Used this place som 10 times.
The begining of A9 to Riga from Liepaja(after crossing a railway) A good point, but u have to write down a direction where are you going(ex.: RIGA, KULDIGA, VENTSPILS)
hitchiked five people. got buses twice in a row.
not a lot of traffic
Almost every car is going to Lithuania. But traffic is not very big - be patient:)

Would agree, awful spot, wouldn't even try this unless during some low traffic hours, got some locals pissed off rather soon here, would recommend a bus stop a bit further which is safer for both, you and the driver, but can see this spot working also
Awful spot, but somehow worked great for us. Its on a curve, just before the bridge, theres a small parking but most drivers dont see it. Catched a local driver, went to Ragana.
Mostly locals stop here, after asking around for 60 minutes I still didn't get any ride. Moved to the bus stop nearby, which is much better spot
Agree. Lots of local traffic, nobody wants to stop. Solo female, cloudy Sunday morning. Waited for 45 minutes and decided to take the bus to Kekava, which was a good decision.
Lots of local traffic, no one stopped at the bus stop for 30min. I tried asking around in the gas station and then a guy took me to the Kekava roundabout.
Can’t say if it’s a good or bad spot because our driver just saw us and offered a ride. But there are many ppl around to ask for a ride.
Nobody stopped. And only residents stop at the gas station.

before the nightfall (around 20h in the summer, meaning actually no real night), some cars in two hours, most of the cars going the other direction, it is mostly a road for tourist, because it is on the coast. probably tourist from central Europa come this way north and go south in central of Latvia, still possible to hitchhike and have more luck on daytime
Friendly folks. 10 cars in over 2 hours. Eventually a bus will come save you.

I can't add a new place to the map (it's hitchwiki.org fault), so i stood a little bit furhter on this road in the direction of Riga (right after the exit from Ludza, you can see it a bit higher on the map) with my friend. Nobody stoped for half an hour, so we took the bus to Rezekne (for 5 euro i guess).

After 1h wait , the police imigration come to check me on with no prob , they where really polite and nice , and so they did stop for me a trucker and asked him to take me with him , he did droped me by the russian border , i wass going toward moscow , i guess most of people where afraid that i wass a migrant ! ( this happen on the 1st and not the 2nd )
Not the best spot, but possible to catch a car
To Riga. There is a hill before this spot so the visibility is not too good it but this seems to be the best option from Nereta.
A bus stop. Speed here is quite high, but enough place to stop. Waiting time variate from 5 to 45 min - depends on how lucky you are.
Bus stop under the bridge, direction East - probably traffic to all directions.
it was very painful hh-inh here. there were many cars but nobody stoped. finally i got a ride because the driver had seen me 70 min before and i was still there.
To hhike before the boarder of Skrunda - speed is not so high and you are visible from a long distance

Direction - Riga (also to get to Talsi, Kandava, Tukums).
If you don't feel like going all the way where the city ends, try your luck here. After the gas station  the road has plenty of space for cars to stop, but the traffic isn't so big since the majority of cars usually take the opposite road (Kurzemes iela/A10). If you don't happen to get a ride, try to go over the railway to Kurzemes iela/A10 (just beware of the trains), but note that it's hard to find a place where a car can stop on that r
To Tukums, To Rīga.

It's not the best place, but there is a lot of traffic and room to stop.

Take a bus (1, 19, 28) to the open air museum, stop 'Brivdabas Muzejs'.

Tried first with sign 'Tallinn', didn't work. The much closer 'Saulkrasti' got us a ride in minutes.

To Sigulda, Valmiera, Valka, Tartu. Not the best idea to hhike on the highway. Police will not arrive ;)just because you stay there, but due to the high speed its very dificult for cars to stop. Be visible and its better to have aplate with your distination goal.

It took me 3 hours to get a ride by a drunk over a stretch of just 5 km. People are shy and don’t like hitchhikers a lot. Eventually you’ll find something but prepare for waiting! If you’ll find a nice ride all the way to the border your life will be a lot easier!

dirction : ti Riga. It looks like nobody will stops here - but usualy you don't stand here more than 10-15 min. If in this time nobody stops - just walk around 2 km and you will see a railway crossroad - try there.:)
To Tukums. It is an old road from Ventspisl to Tukums. Only local cars.
Many local cars witch goes to Saldus (6 km), but if you will write down "Liepaja" on your board - direct car defenetly stops.. but when? :)
Ther is a bus stop and a place to stop a car, but speed is very fast. You must be very active to stop a car here :)
Thre is a bus stop, but speed is high. You can try.:) To Liepaja.
To Liepaja. It looks like a bad hhiking place, but cars stop here.(from personal experience). Just stay near the sign "Aizpute is over"

To Saldus, Sabile, Tukums, Jurmala, Riga.  Its better to write down a destination of your trip, because many cars is turning for Saldus after a bridge (in 500 m). If you not going there, better walk a bit to another hhiking place.
To Stende and Talsi. A lot of local cars - you will not wait long for a lift.:)
To Sabile, Kandava, Tukums, Riga. Not the best spot to hhike, but there is nothing better in 10 km radius.
To Tukums, Riga. There is gas station near, but people not very often agree to take hhikers here.
To Kuldiga, Talsi, Ventspils. Not very good place to hhike, but its possible here. next better hhiking spot in 6 km.
To Jurmala, Riga. Here is better a bit. Speed is 70km/h some place to stop a car.
To Saldus, Liepaja. A lot of cars, place to stop, but a high speed
To Riga. You can stay at the bus stop, but be ready a bit for a lift - the speed of car is quite big to stop.
To Jelgava. You will not stay longer then 15 min here - a lot of cars mostly to Jelgava, but sometimes also to Dobele
To Riga, Talsi, Tukums. It looks like a perfect place for hhiking, but people from Ventspils are not very hitchhikers-friendly.  You must be very activ to bring an attention to your person:)

To Tartu. If you want to avoid to enter the city, you can try to hhike on a ring road. Direct cars to Tartu or Valka usually choose this way, but they are not a majority of traffic. The time that you will spend hhiking on a ring road is more or less like a time that you will walk through the city.
To ringroad, to E67, To Tallinn, to Lithuania. A lot of local cars goes from here till the ring road. There you can choose your direction. Somtimes this spot is more usefull then Jugla's spot.
To Rezekne,to Russia. A lot of cars, but not a lot of place to stop. If nobody stops in 20 min, change position. In 4-5 km ther is a railway crossroad - try there..:)
To Nereta. A place itself is good, but there is very few traffic especialy in winter.

to Riga, Kuldiga, Ventspils. A lot of local cars here (mostly going shopping), but enough place for drivers to stop. and you have a nice chanse to get a car to Grobina (town 10 km from Liepaja), where is a good place for hhiking. Write down your destination aim and if you will not get a lift after 20 min - change position.
to Riga, Ventspils, Kuldiga. Not very good  hhiking position, because speed of cars is quite high, but you are visible from a distance and there is a place to stop a car for drivers.
To Jurmala, Liepaja, Ventspils. It is still possible to hhike here, but the speed of cars is very big. You can get here by foot somehow

On way to Ogre, Aizkraukle, Daugavpils, Russian border. It's a busstop. After the bus stop is a parking place, but sometimes it is full - then better to hh before busstop and after traffic lights.
The cars have to slow down before either because of traffic lights or because of tram rails which cross the street before. Tram 7 or 9 can take you here from city centre. You can go further by bus, but many people think that starting this place and ending just in next town Salaspils is a place for pros

I was hitch hiking from a place nearby here to go to Talsi, passing by Jurmala. From the central bus station next to the big market, I caught bus 43, to Skulta. I am not sure where it drop me off, but from there I walked a while and got a ride. Inform the bus-driver you want to get off at the last stop, otherwise he drives you back to the center!
to Riga. You are visible from a distance here, thats why you will ot stay long.

not bad HH point... cars are very fast but maybe you can catch somebody who living shopping center to your way .P also enough place for cars... waited 30min... you can come here with airport bus from city center...
not very good, but around Durbe it`s a best place to Riga. There is a bus station
Here is good place to hhike to ia, because here cars drive slow

Towards Kegums, dirtroad (!) so beware, as well as very crap internet around these forests, but some traffic from Vecumnieki take this shortcut road towards Kegums/Ogre etc, has more cars than you would imagine, but this road is definitely to be avoided during the dark, wait times of 20-40 minutes expected
Not the best spot, lots of locals, but there is space to stop on the side and gas station nearby (Circle K) if you want to ask. Ended up taking the bus into Riga 2€ after 15 minutes.

Waited with some fellow hitchhiker for 30min, she had already waited 1h. One car had already stopped for her, and one stopped for us before getting the ride. She got a ride towards Pskov, I hopped out at the junction. Saturday, huge amount of cars, also German, French, Dutch, Estonian, Finnish, Swedish...

I did not liked the previous spot, i went a bus stop further and i did not liked it either, i walked until here because then the bus stop are right on the road (no space to stop), so if you take a bus, continue to the next spot people write, but here it worked for me, and quite fast finally (what took me time was to walk here)

I was put here by someone turning on the Talinn road, and here you réalise that most of the cars turn...
The cars are going fast here so it's not good, but it is doable
I walked 2mins otherwise only people who turn can see you
It took me 1min to be taken to Sigulda. But we call that luck for sure
Not the best spot, as the cars are going fast here, but if you have a big sign, cars can see you from a distance. I had a sign saying EST and got a ride to Valga.
Towards Vireši, very low traffic out of Gaujiena and those who go tend to have full cars or speed a lot, ended up walking a km or a bit more before got a car, wait time of 20-50 minutes expected

Towards Gaujiena, but there's barely any traffic here, most likely one of the first cars will pick you up but a lot of them are just local traffic, this road is rather dead, try to avoid or use Estonian side, good luck here, wait time of 20-50 minutes
Not a great spot at all, cars are going fast, but it is doable. A truck stopped and he was going all the way to Tallinn, for me it was enough to get to my grandma’s place near Häädemeeste!

Towards Skaistkalne, there's also a bus stop a bit earlier, if you feel lucky and risky you can stay there, Palejas, the village south is where first cars start coming from to head to Skaistkalne to store, eventually you'll get a ride, but it can take a lot of time, as this road is barely used

Lots of traffic, but very poorly maintained bus stop at winter, you might get better luck from the cafe and petrol station across the road than here, cars were slow, but to get a ride prepare 40+ minutes
Small little spot to catch cars coming from Adaži, direction north, most likely locals, but will help you get to a better place, wait times of 30-70 minutes
Towards Saulkrasti, decent spot, but small bus stop, as well as poor lightning at dark times, wait time of 30-40 minutes
Awkward spot towards south, most cars on highway just speed away, only the cars coming from Limbaži usually stop, wait time of 20-40 minutes, well cleaned at winters tho
A bit of straight road, very little traffic, mostly local, towards Valka, wait time of 45- 90 minutes
Okay spot towards south, but still a bit too close to the city, not too much traffic, has lights so doable at nighttime as well, waiting time here's 20-60 minutes
It may look like a good spot but highway is so close that just walk there, Ape doesn't get much traffic going out from there, here you'd wait for a hour

Direction Ventspils.
Very few cars in the middle of the day, and mostly going to Talsi. Even the few going to Ventspils are going quite fast and so are unlikely to stop. I think it’s doable because their is place for cars to stop.

There was no petrol station when I was there, but there is still space to stop next to the road. The traffic is sorted out so that almost all the cars are going to Lithuania. There was not a lot of traffic when I was there, but I got a lift after 20 minutes to joniskis

Most cars either couldn't take me or were going to a different direction
Once I got a ride, it took me quite a decent distance

There are some cars coming to this gas station.
Wasn't quick, but wasn't long either till got a ride

Walked along the road for quite some time till got a ride to Sigulda.
People occasionally stop and offer help even if they can not take you where you are heading to.

Some cars are going past here.
Took a bit of time to get a ride to Saulkrasti - not too long, but not fast either.
High traffic but almost all cars drive to the city center or suburbs, it's very difficult to ride to the south in direction to Lithuania.
To Riga. Not the best spot but I was dropped off nearby and tried here and was luckily picked up in 5 minutes.
A nice place(bus stop) but almost no traffic
From that little petrol station, in 15 minutes I found a car directly to Kaunas.

One male 40+, no sign, one big and one small backpacks, sunny and warm day. Going to Tallinn.
A good looking spot. A bus stop, cars going downhill.
I was standing there for over 1,5 hours. 3 cars stopped offering me a ride to the next town (5 kms). But it looks there was not a good spot so I skipped the rides. 
In the end I moved to the next bus stop, a few hundred metres west. And there I had more luck.
12 minutes wait :) last weekend
To Saulkrasti, To Parnu, to Tallinn. There is a bus stop and cafe nearby, but you need to wait a bit for a lift. Be patient
Fast traffic, but a kind family did manage to stop within the space. They gave me a short intra-city ride to a better spot for rides North to Estonia.
Thought I'll get a fast ride to Riga. Waited for 2 hours and no one stopped (maybe I wasn't visible enough because it was getting dark, but I've tried diffrent locations). Decided to take a bus.
Not the best place, but it worked very well.
Not the best spot but it worked, try the town before this or the bus stop few hundred meter down the road.
Bad spot. Nobody stops. It shows that you can't stop.
A bit uncomfy to get here, direction to north, but outside of rush hour there's not too many cars coming off here, so they can stop here easily, wait times of 5-10 minutes
Direction Rēzekne. But I think i was lucky bc it realy is still in the city and it was about to rain but next to it is a abandoned fabric and woker houses to stay dry.
its not Balvi,but Alūksne
Here goes about 1 or 2 cars in 10-20 minutes.So you can wait whole day to hitchhike someone.
dont let people drop you off here if you are going north ...

Would not recommend getting stuck here since the cars literally fly past you at high speed. But it's always possible to get a ride, you just have to patient. Have hitchhiked here both in daylight and dark, waited either 20 mins or 4h. Your choice, really.

I tried to hitchhike from petrol station to Aizkraukle, Jekabpils, but it was unsuccessful. I waited 2 hours, and then I go on the road. There is no place to stop a car, but in the middle of the road is a safety island before traffic lights. So, I stood in the middle of road and wait for red light on traffic lights. And then I knocking on car windows and after few minutes get a ride. This is not a good way to hitchhike. But if there is no other chances, you can try to. But you must be very fast,

Quite bad hhing place. Its a gas station near by, but there only local cars are stopping (normaly). If you are here - try to change a position, using those car even for couple km. But better to avoid this place
To Tukums, Riga. Almost dead point. Speed of cars is very high. Try to avoid this place.
To Jurmala, Riga. Many local cars, fast speed and no place to stop, even if drivers want to.

Towards Malpils/Sigulda, made the mistake (?) of walking from Suntaži, awful road as noone even seem to be willing to stop, okay amount of traffic, wait times of 60+ minutes to be expected anywhere along the road

In theory this is the best possible spot for hitching towards Balvi, but in reality almost noone drives there, most cars around here head to Vilaka, waited here for 100 minutes and then just started walking and about a kilometer later a car stopped. One of the main reasons for cars being unwilling to stop may be the tensions between Russians/Latvians as Latvians may fear you might be Russian and wiseversa. Also I was told by a local they have had issues with illegal borderhoppers earlier so peop

First decent spot going towards Rezekne from Daugavpils, but still no luck, even if there is a speed camera, 50km/h zone and a very good bus stop for stopping, it just didnt work out, ended up going for the Mazie Stropi side road, where I got a direct ride immediately, hitching out from anywhere in Daugavpils is quite difficult, wait times of 60+ minutes to be expected for sure, good luck out here
Not that good spot towards the Estonian border. Although, I got picked up by a family and helped them to tidy up a family grave at Saulkrasti cemetery.

Towards Riga, but on a pretty big corner so cars are cautious and during evening no lights, the spot at the railroad crossing is probably way better, as well as using the crossroad to go to Dobele, but here I'd estimate you'd need to wait at least a hour.

A lot of cars, also a lot of foreign  license plates. No one willing to pick me up, it's a bit of a rough neighborhood so people don't trust each other (this is what the driver told me that eventually picked me up). Better go to grobina if you want to go towards ventspils.

There's actually a bus stop around here, you can sit or lay there on the bench waiting for that one car going towards Gaujiena or Valka, good visibility, dirt road and barely used, I'd say it has about a car in every 30-40 minutes, but that one car probably will pick you up also, definitely avoid this road if you are not up for a challenge and avoid (late) evenings
Long straight stretch southbound, most locals will have turned to the villages nearby so now you are just hoping to catch that one car going any further, very low traffic, wait times of 10-50 minutes
Poor spot for going south, head to the roundabout south for better ones, here most is local and no lights at dark times, wait times can be here for more than a hour

Towards north, busy road but a lot of locals, hard for cars to stop, i'd rather get more up the road after the highway junction, also uphill and river if you gonna walk, here wait time would be over a hour
Pretty poor spot for northbound, lots of cars already thinking of junction, also at winter poorly maintained sides, wait time of more than a hour can easily happen

Saulkrasti in general is pretty poor for hitchhiking, lots of tourists at summer, medium local traffic otherwise, more easier to go a bit further north where forest is by the side of the road, here uncomfortable for cars to stop, wait time of 50-90 minutes
Towards Valka, barely any traffic, 1 car in 10-20 minutes, unless "rush hours", mostly locals going nearby, wait time of 30-120 minutes

Another difficult spot, little traffic, at night time here the last lights nearby road are located here, so you probably should gamble here or walk a kilometer more north before Kamaldina road, wait time of 50-120 minutes
People in their cars look very confused, like they don't know what you want from them. Mostly local people.
Not goood idea. This road to Riga is very hard. Its better to go back to Talsi and use big highway.
A local guy who didn't speak English picked us up and took us about 20 kilometers.
No ride :(
didnt get  a ride kind of shit spot but if you take the train one stop further there is more chances but still sux ended up going to get bus to ainaži border and hitch from there to tallin
Don't even try hitchhiking from one of the empty bus stations, it's senseless. Maybe at the gas station you'll be more successful, but generally Ogre isn't the best place to get a lift.
the bus stations does not exist anymore😭 The highway is not available, so you have to Hitch on the district roads where everyone heading to Riga.

Ok, day 1, i already hate this country
Full place to stop, cars going not so fast, only 1 direction, no big turns.
And it's already 1h30 that i'm waiting here ...
An old hag just stopped, and co tinued whan she saw my face
Seriously i came from the Atlantic hitchhacking, and it's the most terrible place of the trip
Towards Tervete, very rarely used border crossing, had 1 car in 1o minutes if lucky, by evening its more of 1 car in 30 minutes, it's doable but it'd take you a long long hours most likely

The road is actually paved til here nowadays, but very uncomfy for cars to stop here, if you have any cars, I'd say there was a car in every 15-30 minutes, but just keep walking along the road, no good spots anywhere here

Towards Kurmene, but really little traffic, 1 car in 20 minutes, you can try hitchhiking anywhere on the road, but didn't work out for me and just slowly walked to Kurmene, there's nice small sitting area down next to Nemunelis

Very difficult spot to go towards Valka, also after that uphill and new bollards they have installed make it very inconvenient, also most cars here are local traffic, wait time can be for hours in here
On the whole street, the curb is very high and there are a lot of fast cars. There are no options where cars can stop. We took the bus to Kauguri and continued from there.
